issues.description: Visibility mismatch for Animal's constructor and name accessor methods: the problem statement (UML and explicit note) requires the Animal constructor and the getName()/setName() accessor methods to use protected visibility (UML shows '#' and the text explicitly requests protected getters/setters), but the solution implementation declares the Animal constructor and both accessor methods as public. This contradicts the specified encapsulation in the exercise and may confuse students about the required visibility for these members.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the Animal constructor and the getName()/setName() methods protected to match the UML and the explicit instruction in the problem statement (or, if public visibility was intended, update the problem statement/UML to state public). Preferable correction: change the solution implementation to use protected for the constructor and both accessor methods so the code matches the exercise specification and teaches the intended encapsulation.
